website_summaries.verdict: The Razor Ice+ is designed by Saucony to tackle icy or wintry conditions. There is no doubt that the traction is absolutely insane, it just does not replace spikes or crampons. But, for trail running, wet and icy conditions are there for the taking. The shoe has quite a responsive ride with the presence of the Everun while a water-resistant upper should be a huge asset when running in the conditions this shoe is made for.
pros: The fleece-lined upper of the Razor Ice+ keeps the foot warm and comfortable during winter
The reviewers were unanimous in praising the traction of this shoe
A built-in gaiter makes winter running more convenient as it keeps water and snow out
A handful noted that it is quite light for a winter-specific shoe
The shoe works fine when hiking, according to a small number of runners
It felt responsive all throughout the runs of several runners
The Runshield upper provides water-resistant protection
It handles speed and distance with equal ease, according to a couple of expert reviewers
The cushioning is excellent in the Razor Ice+, based on more than a few observations from reviewers
The outsole lugs do not prevent runners from using the shoe on icy city streets or pavements
Some runners highly-appreciated the unique aesthetic attraction of this shoe
cons: Saucony’s claim of making ice irrelevant is not fully justified, according to several runners
More than a few users had trouble getting their foot inside as the fit is quite tight
The neoprene upper is very thin and suffered abrasions, even after a few miles, based on the comments of a few runners

customer_reviews.title: I am able to wear my thick Columbia ski socks and be able to zip up comfortably. The shoes look cool
customer_reviews.text: It was made clear that they run small. I wear size 6.5-7 , I bought a 7.5... I am able to wear my thick Columbia ski socks and be able to zip up comfortably. The shoes look cool, very light. Definitely water repellent because I washed/rinsed them under running water. They fit my narrow feet nicely with no pressure points. The only thing I wish they are is warm/er . My toes get cold when I go out and use them. But oh well, I live in the Midwest, we've had single digit temperatures lately.
customer_reviews.author: Aida O.

customer_reviews.title: Had to return because they ran really small.
customer_reviews.text: These run really, really small. I normally wear an 8-8.5, but I always buy a 9 in running shoes so I have a lot of room in the toe. The 9s in these shoes fit like an 8.5, maybe even an 8.
customer_reviews.author: MTinNH

customer_reviews.title: These run small and narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of Saucony that fit perfectly at 8.5, but these don't fit at all. You'll probably need at least 1-2 sizes bigger than your normal size to fit into these. This shoe has two separate layers. The main shoe with cushion is inside the outer thin layer which they call the shield. I love the design, but I was disappointed they did not fit.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Wife says they are very comfortable for her too
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy 1 size over to obtain a fit for my wife's foot with regular thickness socks. But they do fit if ordered large and they work awesomely well on ice. Wife says they are very comfortable for her too!
customer_reviews.author: 20/20 online

customer_reviews.title: Moving up half a size was the right thing to do, these shoes are narrow
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I did buy half a size larger and that was perfect. So in this case 8.5 = 8 in regular running shoes. The cover or sheild over the shoe tightens up the area and you need a slightly larger size. And your normally wearing thicker winter socks which need extra space
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bowyer

customer_reviews.title: After a year still going
customer_reviews.text: It has been a year since I bought this pair of shoes. I have walked them through all kinds of terrains and weather, running and walking one or two hours about 3 times a week and still have lots of life to give...make sure not running on hard icy road because they won’t give enough grip ; also, they are a little tight at the calf level , but no need to zippering all the way up to give you stability... love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amb P.

customer_reviews.title: I love them and also use them to hike in
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair for winter running. I love them and also use them to hike in. Great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Brown

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe, but you need to go up a ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe, but you need to go up a half size or more. I typically wear a size 9 and 10 in running shoes. I purchased a 10, but they were too tight. Especially if you are wearing winter socks that are slightly thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waterproof shoe
customer_reviews.text: I sized up. Fit is great. They’re really hard to zip at first, but once you break them in, they’re fine. They’re 100% waterproof and NOTHING gets inside them!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindey Rundlett

customer_reviews.title: Look great outside but interior was all rough edged and gluey ...
customer_reviews.text: VERY small. Go up at least 1 size. Look great outside but interior was all rough edged and gluey patches. Not sure they would stand up to a MN winter.
customer_reviews.author: Maman

customer_reviews.title: Super small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: I went up a size to account for my warmer socks. But even with my thin socks they were SUPER SUPER narrow.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: I live in Michigan so these were the best invention. around the ankle is a tad tight ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Michigan so these were the best invention. around the ankle is a tad tight but I'm sure it will loosen up in time.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: I order 6.5 was too narrow I loved shoes but too small for my wide foot I returned
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it , love it! Wish they have more insulation and more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: ELENA A JACOBSEN

customer_reviews.title: Good thing I did
customer_reviews.text: In reading other reviews, I decided to go a size up. Good thing I did, the shoe would not have fit in my normal size. The larger size was a bit smaller than expected, however, since it was a whole size up, it's fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: Demetria

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read someone's review that they ran small. I wear a 7 ordered a 7.5. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I liked the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoe, but it is unexpectedly too small, since I have worn size 11 Saucony's for 40 years. I have returned them as instructed, and am waiting for the next size, 11 1/2 to be shipped. Hopefully soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run WAY small
customer_reviews.text: They run WAY too small for normal running shoes. i am normally a 9 to 9.5 for all running shoes, but I am pretty sure I would need a 10 to 10.5 for these to fit comfortably. i was really disappointed because for $180 you would have thought they would have run like their normal saucony shoes. I have already returned these.
customer_reviews.author: Tery

product_meta.title: Saucony womens RAZOR ICE+-W Razor Ice+-w
product_meta.description: Designed specifically for winter running, the Razor ICE+ puts Vibram Arctic Grip in high contact areas for exceptional grip and traction across icy surfaces. Make ice obsolete and run through the deep of the winter in the brand new Razor ICE+.
feature_bullets: Vibram polar ice grip, everun heel insert construction, ebo plate for outsole protection, super-tacky pwrtrac rubber outsole, flex shell water-resistant treatment, isofit upper technology
